title: Donald Trump to 'destroy' Turkey's economy if they ignore his 'unmatched wisdom'
text:
Donald Trump issued a bloodcurdling threat to Turkey, whose President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is pictured right, after announcing plans to withdraw US troops from Northern Syria, which shares a border with Turkey (Pictures: Getty)

Donald Trump has issued a bloodcurdling threat to wipe out Turkey’s economy after announcing plans to withdraw troops from northern Syria.

The President of the United States tweeted Monday: ‘As I have stated strongly before, and just to reiterate, if Turkey does anything that I, in my great and unmatched wisdom, consider to be off limits, I will totally destroy and obliterate the Economy of Turkey (I’ve done before!).

‘They must, with Europe and others, watch over the captured ISIS fighters and families.

‘The US has done far more than anyone could have ever expected, including the capture of 100% of the ISIS Caliphate.

‘It is time now for others in the region, some of great wealth, to protect their own territory. THE USA IS GREAT!’

Donald Trump issued tweets threatening to ‘obliterate’ Turkey’s economy amid mounting criticism of his decision to withdraw US troops from Northern Syria, which is currently controlled by allied Kurdish forces

Trump appeared to be lashing out after being roundly criticized over the withdrawal, which is likely to see Kurdish forces who played a key role in the US defeat of Isis attacked by Turkey.

Turkey, which shares a border with the area of Northern Syria affected by the announcement, has claimed it is only interested in helping prevent the resurgence of Isis.

But political pundits say it does not have the military capacity to do so, and that its President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is far more interested in driving the Kurds from the region where they have historically lived.

Senator Lindsey Graham – one of the president’s most vocal supporters – was among those joining in the condemnation.

Senator Graham tweeted: ‘It is never wise to abandon an ally who has sacrificed on your behalf.

Trump and Erdogan pictured last year. The US president has been accused of leaving Kurdish allies at the mercy of a hostile nation

‘It is never wise to repeat the mistakes of your predecessor.

‘It is never wise to outsource American national security to Turkey or any other nation.

‘Turkey does not have the capability to keep ISIS from re-emerging and their primary target is the Kurds – not ISIS.

‘It would be unwise to believe otherwise.’

Graham claims the US will use economic sanctions to keep Turkey in check if necessary.

Former US Ambassador to the UN Nikki Haley, previously known for her closeness to Trump, also criticized the president.

She tweeted: ‘We must always have the backs of our allies, if we expect them to have our back.

‘The Kurds were instrumental in our successful fight against ISIS in Syria. Leaving them to die is a big mistake. #TurkeyIsNotOurFriend.’

Removing US troops from the embattled area leaves allied Syrian Kurdish forces – the YPG – who helped combat Isis vulnerable to an attack from Turkey.

Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan considers the YPG terrorists, and has repeatedly resisted calls to grant the Kurdish people autonomy.

Turkey has officially been at war with the YPG since 1984.

Erdogan – who has been condemned for dragging once-secular Turkey back towards Islamist authoritarianism – has vowed to create a new ‘safe zone.’

That would push the YPG 20 miles away from the Turkish border.

The YPG have vowed to ‘defend northeast Syria at all costs.’
description: President Trump lashed out amid mounting criticism over his decision to withdraw US troops from northern Syria, leaving Kurdish allies at the mercy of Turkey
